content: Yes, I would recommend "Ceremony" by Leslie Marmon Silko. This novel centers around a Laguna Pueblo man named Tayo, as he returns home from World War II and struggles to reconcile the traditional spiritual beliefs of his community with the influence of Western culture. Through Tayo's journey, the novel explores the ways in which Native American peoples were impacted by colonization, as well as the role of spiritual traditions in resisting and surmounting these challenges. Silko's writing also incorporates elements of Pueblo mythology, making "Ceremony" a powerful and engaging exploration of Native American spirituality during the colonial period.
